title: Unity3d C# Mobile Games Developer
description:
Excellent knowledge of Unity 3D, including experience with scripting, textures, animation, GUI styles.

Unity, Unreal experience development is must.

Experience with game physics and particle systems.

Experience with AR/VR development.

XYSLAB focuses on Mobile, Mobile Games, Blockchains, and Mobile Application. Their company has offices in Agadir. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.xyslab.com

title: Data Engineer (Remote)
description:
Join Gemography and work with top tech startups and engineering teams from New York, LA, San Francisco and Paris on large-scale applications and systems. It's long term, remote and comes with indefinite period employment contract.

You will work on:
• Take ownership and responsibility of data produced by the data pipelines.
• Maintain and update ETL data pipelines as well as create new ones.
• Document, identify and automate common data and pipeline operations.
• Participate in standups/meetings and operate in a team environment with agile methodologies.
• Monitor the status of data pipelines and act correspondingly.
• Ensure data produced has the right format/quality and that associated metadata is properly documented.

What we are looking for:
• Experience with data engineering, preferably in Python.
• You’re a fast learner, can contribute from day one as well as integrate and apply new concepts quickly.
• You take pride in what you create and passionate about getting the details... right, even when no one's looking.
• You are able to weigh tradeoffs, articulate complex ideas, and have precision about what you know and don't know.
• You enjoy staying on top of tech trends and hacking new things.
• Proficiency in written and spoken English.

Bonus points if you have:
• Hands-on experience in SQL tuning, schema design or analytical programming.
• Familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow or similar technologies.
• A graduate degree in Computer Science or similar discipline.

Benefits & Perks
• Competitive salaries and performance bonuses.
• Your own Spotify Premium and Netflix accounts.
• 24-days paid time-off (+ public holidays).
• Health insurance & pension.

Important
• Resume/cover letter are optional.
• The job role is fully remote (anywhere in Egypt).
• It's long term and comes with an indefinite period employment contract

title: Ingénieur DevOps en Full Remote (Maroc) en CDI
description:
Créée en 2012, Alphorm est une plateforme française de la formation en ligne, pour les professionnels de l'informatique.

Parce que l’informatique est l’une des rares sphères dans lesquelles on peut encore réussir par ses propres efforts et sa seule volonté,nous voulons proposer des formations de qualité accessibles à toute personne travailleuse, et déterminée à réussir.

Alphorm, en bref :
• plus de 300 formations informatiques en vidéo
• à usage professionnel
• sur les principaux domaines IT (virtualisation & cloud, programmation, bases de données, sécurité & hacking, réseaux et systèmes, bureautique, conception 3D, ...)
• nos formations préparent aux certifications des principaux éditeurs (Cisco, VMware, Microsoft, Citrix, WinDev, Oracle, RedHat, PCSoft, AutoDesk, ...)
• 3 à 10 nouvelles formations publiées chaque mois
• accessibles 24/7 sur desktop et mobile, en ligne et hors-ligne
• un réseau de 50 experts-formateurs certifiés et reconnus
• plus de 63.000 apprenants
• de plus en... plus d’entreprises et de collectivités utilisent Alphorm pour former leurs équipes informatiques : SNCF, Safran, Mairie de Paris, Sopra Stéria, Neurones IT, Sogeti, Generali Assurances, Volkswagen France, Saint Etienne Métropole, CCI Région Nord, …

Alphorm donne chaque jour le meilleur d’elle-même pour ses apprenants. Pour poursuivre notre développement, nous recherchons des personnes pleines de talent, d’idées créatives et d’énergie, qui partagent cette vision et veulent y contribuer.

Alphorm a son bureau sur Rabat Agdal et recrute plusieurs profils en Full Remote (Télétravail)

Site web : http://www.alphorm.com/

Sous la tutelle de l'architecte de la plateforme Alphorm, tu seras responsable de l'architecture, du design et de l'amélioration de la plateforme, sur l'aspect infrastructure. Tu reprendras nos clusters Kubernetes hébergés dans le cloud. Tu feras un audit et sélectionnera les technologies open source au dessus desquelles nous pouvons nous construire. Tu seras responsable du delivery et de la stabilité. Tu mettras à disposition des développeurs tout le nécessaire pour qu'ils puissent délivrer des solutions de haute qualité grâce au CI, CD et aux tests automatisés. Tu accueilleras et mentoreras les nouveaux ingénieurs sur la stack, et partageras les résultats de ta veille technique à tes collègues. Enfin, tu apporteras ta créativité dans le projet, tu poseras tes briques, car ce projet, c'est aussi le tiens !

Nous travaillons en agile (Scrum) et notre stack technique est variée et moderne : AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Rancher, Event Store, Postgresql, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana, Sonarqube, Azure DevOps CD, Azure DevOps CI, Grafana

Missions :
• Amélioration de l'intégration et des livraisons continues (CI / CD)
• Mise en place et déploiement des outils Cloud
• Développement et amélioration des étapes de build, de déploiement de tests et de production de l’application
• Amélioration de l'observabilité de la plateforme (monitoring, logging)
• Proposer et implémenter des outils et des pratiques pour optimiser le temps du passage d'une demande utilisateur jusqu'à son intégration et son déploiement (intégration et déploiement continus).

Profil recherché :

La vision d'Alphorm et son potentiel vous plaisent déjà ?

Vous souhaitez rejoindre une équipe à taille humaine et mettre en place de nouvelles idées ?

Voici le profil que nous recherchons :
• Excellente communication orale et écrite
• Capacité à apprendre vite, à intégrer rapidement les conseils et les meilleures pratiques
• Capacité d’écoute, patience et bienveillance
• Sens du service : vous adorez aider les gens à résoudre leurs problèmes
• Personnalité positive
• Capacité à trouver des solutions/réponses simples, claires et efficaces à tous les problèmes/questions
• Savoir créer une bonne qualité relationnelle dès les premières secondes d'un contact
• Capacité à prendre des initiatives et à être autonome
• Sens de l'organisation, avec une grande attention aux détails
• Capacité à se remettre en cause pour le bien du client

Package proposé :
• Statut : CDI
• Rémunération : à négocier
• Localisation : Full Remote (Télétravail)
• Avantages particuliers : à discuter

title: Développeur Fullstack
description:
Votre rôle et vos responsabilités
• Participer à la conception et au développement de nouvelles fonctionnalités.
• Amélioration et mise à niveau de projets existants.
• Participer aux meetups et aux formations continues.
• Revue de code en équipe et mise en place de tests automatisés.
• Vous traitez une grande variété de problèmes techniques.
• Participer aux spécifications fonctionnelles.

Votre profil
• Tu sais développer en React (ou Angular ou Vue.js)
• Tu as une une bonne connaissance des langages Python ou Java ou Ruby ou PHP ou Javascript et d’un ou plusieurs framework récents.
• Tu es à l’aise en anglais ou en français.
• Volonté de toujours progresser et forte curiosité technique,
• Vrai intérêt pour les bonnes pratiques de développement (bonnes pratiques, tests unitaires, documentation, etc.),
• Grande capacité d’adaptation à tous types de technologies.

Vous êtes débutant(e) ?

Pas de soucis ! Un bootcamp sera défini après les les entretiens en fonction de vos connaissances... du sujet et des technologies

title: General Manager (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Can you look at complex operations, find the patterns, and figure out ways to simplify? Are you a hands-on detail freak, driven to learn every element of your operations down to the lowest level of detail? Do you love seeing your customers succeed because of your hard work?

If you prefer driving change to “driving the bus”, this is the place to fast-track your career in Operations. You will deliver instant impact, executing hands-on operational transformations across our constantly expanding enterprise software portfolio. Our goal is to acquire a new software company every week, and we have developed proven Operating Principles enabling us to turn negative-margin software companies into financial winners, every time. We buy complexity and make it simple. That’s the job.

You’ll learn how to build a world-leading software company in our revolutionary, fully remote operating environment. We have built our software factory the same way Tesla approaches building cars. As Elon Musk has... stated, what really matters is the machine that builds the machine - the factory - which is at least two orders of magnitude harder than the product itself.

Joining us is a great career move! You will literally be helping to build the future of work, to a level of quality that exceeds the global standards you’ll find anywhere else. Apply now to start your long-term career path with us!

What You Will Be Doing

Deep-Diving into our operations, analyzing operational gaps vs. our factory principles at the lowest level of detail. You’ll be driving quality improvements on the inside and customer success on the outside. We have a detailed Operations Playbook to help you get started, and a revolutionary software Factory that you’ll leverage to make it all happen. Bring your operational skills to bear, not merely following the playbook, but improving it.

What You Won’t Be Doing

You will not be doing sales and marketing. Your job is to transform the operations, enabling the CEO to focus on go-to-market.

You will not be doing HR and administrative management. We have systematized the work activities of every role, so you can focus on the execution of your transformations. You’ll be amazed at how effectively the Factory carries out your direction!

You will not be overseeing steady-state operations. Once you get a business unit to a state of smooth sailing, we’ll assign you to the next challenge.

General Manager Key Responsibilities
• Develop a comprehensive understanding of a business unit’s operations
• Transform the business unit by executing our playbook
• Enhance/Improve our transformation process (the Playbook)

Basic Requirements
• Technical/quantitative university degree
• Enterprise software experience at an executive level
• Cross-functional ops experience (including engineering, customer support, professional services, managed services, or other operational areas)
• Leader of large-scale transformation projects (not merely a participant)

Nice-to-have Requirements
• Hands-on software development experience
• Experience in a shared-services or centralized environment
• P&L responsibility $50M+

About Crossover

Crossover has been a pioneer of the remote work model since our inception in 2010 - helping thousands of people find great work opportunities. We focus on full-time, long-term work - not short-term "gigs" or freelancing side jobs. Most of our positions are within a large and growing portfolio of software companies. Since we focus on remote work, our openings can be filled globally and pay standardized compensation rates, regardless of where you choose to live.

Join the thousands of professionals that have partnered with Crossover to explore new opportunities and find their dream job. Go to www.crossover.com/testimonials to read their stories. Better yet, write your own story!

What to expect next:
• You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
• Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
• You will be paired up with one of our recruiting specialists who can answer questions you might have about the process, role, or company, and help you get to the final interview step.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
• First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
• Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
• Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
• If all else fails, just visit https://jobs.crossover.com directly, search for this job, and click “Apply”. You will be prompted to reset your password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Crossover Job Code: LJ-4160-MA-Casablan-GeneralManager.013

title: Technical Lead, Gemography
description:
About Gemography (formerly United Remote)

We're not solving a small problem and we're not doing it the lousy way. We are building end-to-end products, processes, and infrastructure to enable distributed engineering teams to form and operate.

At Gemography, you will have a massive impact: you will help define product strategy and turn big ambitious ideas into products that inspire. You will create gorgeous products that millions of people use for hours every single day.

As a Lead Software Engineer, you will join as a core member of a 12-person product team with extensive experience building and scaling platforms, systems and databases at startups and big corp.

What You'll Do Day-to-day
• Develop new products and features as well as improve existing products and features.
• Contribute to the technical and product design process, break down large tasks.
• Investigate the edge-cases, exploring any problems that arise in-depth and proactively proposing solutions.
• Work with product... and design teams to develop new ideas and explore new opportunities.
• Lead and mentor other team members to reach their full potential.
• Improve engineering processes and tools to increase team effectiveness.

Our Tech Stack
• Backend: GraphQL, Express.js, MongoDB.
• Frontend: React, Vue.js.
• DevOps: Docker, DigitalOcean, AWS.
• Collaboration: Slack, Linear, Notion.
• Mobile: React Native.

Here’s What We’re Looking For
• In-depth knowledge of at least one frontend framework (React, Vue.js, Angular) and one backend framework (Rails, Django, Express ...).
• You’re a fast learner, can contribute from day one as well as integrate and apply new concepts quickly.
• You take pride in what you create and passionate about getting the details right, even when no one's looking.
• You are able to weigh tradeoffs, articulate complex ideas, and have precision about what you know and don't know.
• Comfortable dealing with ambiguity, setting milestones and deliverables for the team.
• Strong communication (English or French) and willingness to learn, and mentor others.
• You can break down tricky topics in writing and in person.
• You get a lot done quickly, and can translate your skills into new processes that your team will follow.

Benefits & Perks
• Competitive salaries and performance bonuses.
• Your own Spotify Premium and Netflix accounts.
• Competitive gaming on PS4 and Nintendo Switch.
• 24-days paid-time-off (+ public holidays).
• Health insurance & pension (CNSS).

Location

Rabat, Morocco

title: Managing Director (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
It’s not every day a full-time, long-term, fully remote executive-level position opens up at a 500+ people software company. Work from anywhere, managing a company with 500+ people from 100+ different countries. Our workforce is composed of the top 1% of talent from all around the world. Working with super-smart, high paced colleagues enables you to build a dream-team with exceptional performance.

In this role, you will be transforming slow-paced, complex software companies into what we believe is the future of work. You will have to transform and operate multiple different software companies each with its own challenges. Learn how to operate them in our unique, revolutionary, fully remote operating environment. Work in a super fast-paced environment with new software companies joining the portfolio monthly and several evaluated weekly. Grow your career at a rapid pace, receive daily coaching and weekly performance reviews, improve your skills and deliver unprecedented business... results.

Being successful in our organization requires being hands-on, into the details, fast to react, quick to process and eager to deliver great results every day. Making day to day decisions that have an immediate impact on the company’s blueprint and on customer success.

Joining us is a smart career move as within a short period of time you’ll evolve your skills to become a "future of work" executive that exceeds any global standards of any company out there

title: Technical Recruiter
description:
About Gemography (formerly United Remote)

We're not solving a small problem and we're not doing it the lousy way. We are building end-to-end products, processes, and infrastructure to enable distributed engineering teams to form and operate.

At Gemography, you will have a massive impact: you will help define sourcing strategy and turn big ambitious ideas into outreach campaigns that inspire.

What You'll Do Day-to-day
• Own full cycle sourcing from intake to prospect to candidate conversion.
• Proactively source, recruit, engage, and maintain a strong candidate pipeline.
• Constant interaction with potential candidates on professional networks and social media.
• Measure and improve response and conversion rate metrics for the talent pipeline.
• Networking through industry contacts, events/meetups, online groups and social media.
• Prepare weekly dashboard reporting, ad hoc reports, and presentations as needed.
• Contacting Industry partners for candidate referrals.

Here’s What... We’re Looking For
• Keen knowledge of current, trending, and new sourcing tools and platforms.
• Experience implementing creative sourcing methods through multiple channels.
• Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.
• You can operate with a sense of urgency and with flexibility of schedule as needed.
• You are intellectually curious, with an appetite to test new approaches & continually improve sourcing efforts.
• Ability to work in fast paced cross-functional environment.
• Familiarity with copywriting/copy-editing skills.
• Proficiency in written and spoken English.

Benefits & Perks
• Competitive salaries and performance bonuses.
• Your own Spotify Premium and Netflix accounts.
• 24-days paid-time-off (+ public holidays).
• Health insurance & pension

title: Principal Designer (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Do you have an extensive background and strong opinions in designing web and mobile applications? Have you led a design team? Do you have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to make independent decisions and implement creative decisions based on user research and customer feedback? If you are passionate about enterprise application design and creating an awesome user experience, this role is a perfect fit for you!

In this role, you will probably learn and grow 10X faster than in most other positions in the industry as, instead of being siloed and working on a single product for years, you will be delivering designs across a large number of products and industries, working directly with important stakeholders.

What You Will Be Doing

The core activities of this role are:
• Reviewing work done by your team. You will start your day reviewing the work of other team members and ensuring that they are following common UX best practices and 3rd party design... system guidelines before their work reaches our customers. While doing your daily reviews, you'll also be responsible for finding patterns in subpar work and proposing quality bar improvements.
• Working on the most important or challenging design tasks. You'll start by reviewing Use Case requests and communicating with the business owner if something is not clear until you fully understand requirements. After that, you'll start with a first iteration where you need to prepare a User Flow diagram and low-fidelity designs (wireframes). After finishing all the wireframes you'll present them to the stakeholder the next day, get the initial feedback and iterate towards the final design.
• Hosting daily review calls with stakeholders. During these daily iterations, you will gather feedback from stakeholders, get a chance to fail fast and early in the process, which will allow you to fix any issues before the next day's iteration, instead of waiting for several weeks. Once UX design is approved, you'll need to polish it for development and apply our UI library components to the design making it a high-fidelity so that it can be transferred to our development team. All the time, you will need to pay close attention to our standards and guidelines in order to produce perfect quality designs.

Principal Designer Key Responsibilities
• Review designs done by more junior UX/UI designers on the team
• Propose improvements to our quality bars and our standardized processes
• Iterate daily by communicating daily with senior stakeholders on new product ideas
• Work with design systems to produce apps with an outstanding user-experience
• Create compelling visual content and high fidelity clickable prototypes

Basic Requirements
• Minimum 1 year experience in leading a UX/UI design team
• Minimum 3 years experience in hands-on UX and UI design
• Proven record of high-quality web design and a portfolio to back that up
• Able to work on a macOS in order to use Sketch and InVision
• Innate drive to create pixel perfect assets and designs
• Ability to take initiative within the remote environment
• Comfortable working in a fast-paced iterative/agile design process based on daily feedback loops
• Great English verbal communication skills

Nice-to-have Requirements
• Experience using a 3rd-party Design System such as Google Material, IBM Carbon or similar
• Experience with graphic illustration using vector-based tools (such as Illustrator)
• Experience with data-driven design
• Experience with responsive and adaptive design principles and UI/UX best practices

About Crossover

Crossover has been a pioneer of the remote work model since our inception in 2010 - helping thousands of people find great work opportunities. We focus on full-time, long-term work - not short-term "gigs" or freelancing side jobs. Most of our positions are within a large and growing portfolio of software companies. Since we focus on remote work, our openings can be filled globally and pay standardized compensation rates, regardless of where you choose to live.

Join the thousands of professionals that have partnered with Crossover to explore new opportunities and find their dream job. Go to www.crossover.com/testimonials to read their stories. Better yet, write your own story!

What to expect next:
• You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
• Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
• You will be paired up with one of our recruiting specialists who can answer questions you might have about the process, role, or company, and help you get to the final interview step.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
• First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
• Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
• Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
• If all else fails, just visit https://jobs.crossover.com directly, search for this job, and click “Apply”. You will be prompted to reset your password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Crossover Job Code: LJ-4226-MA-Casablan-PrincipalDesig.003

title: Sales Development Representative Internship
description:
• Important note: This internship is focused mainly on pre-sales (Leads research, qualification...) and will not involve calls or meetings with clients. We're seeking a gifted hunter for lead qualification and sales to join our office, in Rabat.
As a Sales Development intern, your role involves the research of high-quality leads, qualifying each opportunity and building qualified prospects lists that will be launched by our Account Executives.
About United Remote
United Remote (formerly known as Hidden Founders) finds, hires and trains top tech talent in developing countries to help them join international startups, remotely and for full-time positions.
In our quest to source young tech passionate minds, we don't require resumes. Instead, we base our selection on side projects, coding skills and personality. Along with in-person interviews and coding assignments, to select startup-savvy developers.
Last year we helped more than 10 Startups from L.A., NYC, and Paris hire the best and... brightest developers from Morocco. And we've been growing steadily since, thanks to our Hiring Stack.
Our Mission & Vision
• We are a highly technical team, including the founders.
• We're on a mission to bring remote opportunities to good developers, wherever they are. We believe remote work is the future of work, and we're working hard to play our part in enabling that revolution.
• We build, analyze & iterate on our systems and processes constantly. You'll never hear around here that "it's the way it has always been done". We embrace change, and constant optimization is in our DNA. If there is something we can make better, faster, or smarter, we're down for it.
• We strongly believe every person who made it on the team has the potential to make a huge impact on the mission we're on.
• We are committed to building an inclusive & diverse team of passionate & ethical hackers, where everyone can grow by doing what they do best. What You'll be doing
• You'll be working within the sales team, side by side with our Accounts executive to uncover and create well-qualified new opportunities which result in closed business.
• You'll get a hands-on training on United Remote's Sales process.
• You will learn how to find relevant data and extract them
• You will help optimize & automate the sourcing process from A to Z.
• You will find and collect smart data and market information to boost our CRM.
• You will be responsible for the monitoring, cleaning and enrichment of our CRM in Hubspot and Outreach. Job Requirements
• You're willing to have a high impact with visible results, being part of internationalizing a successful Moroccan startup,
• Able to implement feedback while being dedicated to continuous self-improvement,
• You can communicate effectively in French and English.
• Able to scrape and analyze data.
• Rigor and organization (ability to manage tightly, over time, a large quantity of information).
• Nice-to-have: knowledge of CRM systems. Perks & Benefits
• Paid Internship
• Amazing startup atmosphere and team spirit.
• Immersion in the global startup ecosystem and an opportunity to work with some of the most promising startups from Paris, London and NYC.
• Free Spotify Premium and Netflix accounts.
• Weekly game night

title: Lead Fullstack Developer, Gemography
description:
About Gemography (formerly United Remote)
We're not solving a small problem and we're not doing it the lousy way. We are building end-to-end products, processes, and infrastructure to enable distributed engineering teams to form and operate.
At Gemography, you will have a massive impact: you will help define product strategy and turn big ambitious ideas into products that inspire. You will create gorgeous products that millions of people use for hours every single day.
As a Lead Software Engineer, you will join as a core member of a 12-person product team with extensive experience building and scaling platforms, systems and databases at startups and big corp.
What You'll Do Day-to-day
• Develop new products and features as well as improve existing products and features.
• Contribute to the technical and product design process, break down large tasks.
• Investigate the edge-cases, exploring any problems that arise in-depth and proactively proposing solutions.
• Work with product and... design teams to develop new ideas and explore new opportunities.
• Lead and mentor other team members to reach their full potential.
• Improve engineering processes and tools to increase team effectiveness. Our Tech Stack
• Backend: GraphQL, Express.js, MongoDB.
• Frontend: React, Vue.js.
• DevOps: Docker, DigitalOcean, AWS.
• Collaboration: Slack, Linear ( https://linear.app/ ), Notion.
• Mobile: React Native. Here's What We're Looking For
• In-depth knowledge of at least one frontend framework (React, Vue.js, Angular) and one backend framework (Rails, Django, Express ...).
• You're a fast learner, can contribute from day one as well as integrate and apply new concepts quickly.
• You take pride in what you create and passionate about getting the details right, even when no one's looking.
• You are able to weigh tradeoffs, articulate complex ideas, and have precision about what you know and don't know.
• Comfortable dealing with ambiguity, setting milestones and deliverables for the team.
• Strong communication (English or French) and willingness to learn, and mentor others.
• You can break down tricky topics in writing and in person.
• You get a lot done quickly, and can translate your skills into new processes that your team will follow. Benefits & Perks
• Competitive salaries and performance bonuses.
• Your own Spotify Premium and Netflix accounts.
• Competitive gaming on PS4 and Nintendo Switch.
• 24-days paid-time-off (+ public holidays).
• Health insurance & pension (CNSS). Location
Rabat, Morocco

title: Data Engineer
description:
Join Gemography and work with one of our partner tech companies and engineering teams from New York, San Francisco and Paris on large-scale applications and systems. It's long term, fully remote and comes with an indefinite period employment contract, perks and benefits.

You will work on:
• Take ownership and responsibility of data produced by the data pipelines.
• Maintain and update ETL data pipelines as well as create new ones.
• Document, identify and automate common data and pipeline operations.
• Participate in standups/meetings and operate in a team environment with agile methodologies.
• Monitor the status of data pipelines and act correspondingly.

• Experience with data engineering, preferably in Python.
• You're a fast learner, can contribute from day one as well as integrate and apply new concepts quickly.
• You take pride in what you create... and passionate about getting the details right, even when no one's looking.
• You are able to weigh tradeoffs, articulate complex ideas, and have precision about what you know and don't know.
• You enjoy staying on top of tech trends and hacking new things.
• Proficiency in written and spoken English.

Bonus points if you have:
• Hands-on experience in SQL tuning, schema design or analytical programming.
• Familiar with Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow or similar technologies.
• A graduate degree in Computer Science or similar discipline.

Benefits & Perks
• Competitive salaries and performance bonuses.
• Your own Spotify Premium and Netflix accounts.
• 24-days paid time-off (+ public holidays).
• Health insurance & pension.

• Resume/cover letter are optional.
• The job role is fully remote (anywhere in Egypt).
• It's long term and comes with an indefinite period employment contract

title: Deployment Specialist (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Do you get aggravated by downtime caused by human error? Do you yearn for time to write high-quality automations that are testable and repeatable so your team can avoid those errors? In this role, you will be responsible for eliminating toil and make a large contribution to our ability to rapidly acquire software products and scale our infrastructure.

Every day will require you to dig into new technologies running across thousands of servers and to deliver simplified, high availability, cost-optimized infrastructure. And due to the size of our partnership with Amazon, you'll have the opportunity to beta-test and experiment with new AWS services.

Don't work in a role where you continue to be bogged down by support tasks or the reactive work that comes with outages. Throw your hat into the ring and apply for a role that stretches your site reliability talents to new boundaries.

What You Will Be Doing

Instead of being focused on polishing one product, or being stuck with the same set... of technologies, a site-reliability engineering role in our company means your tech stack evolves weekly with each new product added to our portfolio. This role is focused on:
• Working with infrastructure at a massive scale producing simple, meticulously engineered infrastructure that continuously improves.
• Producing automation runbooks that remove non-value-add work from our support teams and migrate components to standardized infrastructure
• Introducing changes quickly and applying cutting edge technologies.

What You Won’t Be Doing
• Responding to trouble tickets
• Building bespoke infrastructure solutions
• System administration tasks

Deployment Specialist Key Responsibilities

Say good-bye to an outage resolution mindset and dedicate your day to producing simplified, high availability, cost optimized infrastructure improvements.
• Identify quarterly goals that will deliver standardized, high availability and cost optimized infrastructure
• Create and execute Infrastructure as Code runbooks
• Plan and execute lift and shift projects for acquired products

Basic Requirements
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related technical field
• 3+ years of hands-on experience with AWS Services (compute, databases, networking)
• In-depth knowledge and 2+ years of hands-on experience with Linux
• Basic programming skills in one of our core languages (Java, C++, Python, Javascript)
• Ability to pack application into containers (Docker) and deploy to Kubernetes
• Ability to deploy and configure infrastructure for running virtual machines (VMWare)

Nice-to-have Requirements
• AWS Solutions Architect certification is a plus

About Crossover

Crossover has been a pioneer of the remote work model since our inception in 2010 - helping thousands of people find great work opportunities. We focus on full-time, long-term work - not short-term "gigs" or freelancing side jobs. Most of our positions are within a large and growing portfolio of software companies. Since we focus on remote work, our openings can be filled globally and pay standardized compensation rates, regardless of where you choose to live.

Join the thousands of professionals that have partnered with Crossover to explore new opportunities and find their dream job. Go to www.crossover.com/testimonials to read their stories. Better yet, write your own story!

What to expect next:
• You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
• Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
• You will be paired up with one of our recruiting specialists who can answer questions you might have about the process, role, or company, and help you get to the final interview step.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
• First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
• Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
• Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
• If all else fails, just visit https://jobs.crossover.com directly, search for this job, and click “Apply”. You will be prompted to reset your password if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Crossover Job Code: LJ-3343-MA-Casablan-DeploymentSpec

title: Fullstack Developer, Ring Capital
description:
About Gemography (formerly United Remote)
By joining Gemography you get to work with top tech startups and engineering teams from New York, San Francisco and Paris on large-scale applications and systems, right from our tech campus in the heart of Rabat, Morocco.
As a Fullstack Engineer at Ring Capital, you'll be a core team member of Ring Capital's distributed engineering team split between Paris and Rabat.
Qualifications
• Experience with software engineering with one or more general programming languages (e.g. Python, JavaScript, or Ruby)
• You care about code quality and you know what it means to ship high quality code.
• You know and want to learn more about software best practices such as refactoring, clean code, CI/CD.
• Fast learning - You're a fast learner, can contribute from day one as well as integrate and apply new concepts quickly.
• Ownership - You take pride in what you create and passionate about getting the details right, even when no one's looking.
• Clear thinking... - You are able to weigh tradeoffs, articulate complex ideas, and have precision about what you know and don't know.
• Passion for technology - you enjoy staying on top of tech trends and hacking new things.
• Proficiency in either French or English is required. Benefits & Perks
• Competitive salaries and performance bonuses.
• Your own Spotify Premium and Netflix accounts .
• Competitive gaming on PS4 and Nintendo Switch.
• 24-days paid time-off (+ public holidays).
• Health insurance & pension (CNSS). Important
Resume/Cover Letter are optional. If you choose to upload one, you can use French or English. Both are great options
